wikipedia_page.main: Kenneth Lambert (7 June 1928 – 29 June 2002) was an English professional footballer from Sheffield. His clubs included Barnsley, Swindon Town, Gillingham and Bradford City. He made 97 Football League appearances.

response: In July, 1952, he transferred to Gillingham of the Football League Third Division South, who, in 1950, were voted in to the Football League when it expanded from 88 teams to 92. During his first season at Priestfield he was joint top scorer contributing 10 goals in 34 appearances and scored 1 goal in 3 FA Cup appearances. This made him the club's joint leading league goal scorer with Ken Lambert. In 1953-54 he made 26 league appearances scoring 4 goals and in 1954-55 he represented Gillingham 7 times.
